citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
Dogs BZL7 (Boris) and LZB4 (Landing) both have saliva staining on the medial aspect of both front paws and redness
and crusting between medial toes. According to both HQR Animal Care Health Check Records, their coat and skin were
checked on 7/18/2025 and no notations were made about these conditions.
Dog JPZ3 (Jeep) has a circular area of red skin above his medial toe. According to the HQR Animal Care Health Check
Record, his coat and skin were checked on 7/18/2025 and no notations were made about this condition.
There are no Health Check Requests regarding any of the dog’s paw saliva staining and skin redness to show that these
problems were communicated to the AV. Redness and inflammation of skin and redness and crusting between the toes
can indicate irritation, infection, trauma or other medical problems and could result in discomfort or pain to the animal.
The registrant must ensure that daily observation of all animals is conducted to assess their health and well-being. They
must also ensure that a mechanism of direct and frequent communication is in place so that timely and accurate
information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian. To be
corrected from this date forward: 4 August 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the attending veterinarian and the registrant.
Additional Inspectors:
Gustavo Soberano, Assistant Director n

narrative:
2.33(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
Dogs BZL7 (Boris) and LZB4 (Landing) both have saliva staining on the medial aspect of both front paws and redness 
and crusting between medial toes. According to both HQR Animal Care Health Check Records, their coat and skin were 
checked on 7/18/2025 and no notations were made about these conditions. 
 
Dog JPZ3 (Jeep) has a circular area of red skin above his medial toe. According to the HQR Animal Care Health Check 
Record, his coat and skin were checked on 7/18/2025 and no notations were made about this condition. 
 
There are no Health Check Requests regarding any of the dog’s paw saliva staining and skin redness to show that these 
problems were communicated to the AV. Redness and inflammation of skin and redness and crusting between the toes 
can indicate irritation, infection, trauma or other medical problems and could result in discomfort or pain to the animal.  
 
The registrant must ensure that daily observation of all animals is conducted to assess their health and well-being. They 
must also ensure that a mechanism of direct and frequent communication is in place so that timely and accurate 
information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed to the attending veterinarian. To be 
corrected from this date forward: 4 August 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the attending veterinarian and the registrant. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Gustavo Soberano, Assistant Director n
